decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to maintain a strong aggressive presence on the board by utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to control the board and limit the opponent's resources with counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive cards like Wasteland. The deck's access to card draw with Treasure Cruise and filtering with Brainstorm allows for consistent card advantage and fuel for its aggressive strategy.

The focus of this deck is to play aggressively with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf, backed up by powerful disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Stifle to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands. Its card draw engine consists of Ponder and Brainstorm, with Treasure Cruise providing additional card advantage.

The main goal of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro - Delver deck is to control the game through disruption spells like Abrupt Decay, Daze, and Force of Will, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan using counter magic and removal spells. By efficiently using card draw spells like Brainstorm and Treasure Cruise, the deck can maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Stifle, Daze, and Wasteland. The deck also aims to dig for more threats and answers with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Treasure Cruise, while protecting its board with counterspells like Force of Will. The inclusion of cards like Abrupt Decay and Dimir Charm provides versatile removal options to deal with a variety of threats.

The main concept of this Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by playing taxing creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker while also utilizing disruptive lands like Karakas and Wasteland. The deck aims to control the board with creatures like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp while also applying pressure with efficient beaters like Serra Avenger and Brimaz, King of Oreskos. Additionally, the deck can equip powerful equipments like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further increase its threat level and win the game through combat damage.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and trigger powerful effects such as Bridge from Below. The deck aims to use cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study to help fill up the graveyard, while utilizing creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp to dredge through the deck and put more cards into the graveyard. Once the graveyard is sufficiently filled, the deck can use Dread Return to reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Flame-Kin Zealot to win the game.

The main concept of this combo Dredge deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Nether Shadow, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Stinkweed Imp, then use cards like Balustrade Spy and Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Flayer of the Hatebound for a devastating attack. Cabal Therapy and Gitaxian Probe help disrupt your opponent's strategy while also filling your graveyard with key cards. Utilizing the dredge mechanic and sacrificing creatures for value, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive graveyard-based strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt opponents while also accelerating mana production and generating card advantage. It aims to lock down the board with cards like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, while also setting up powerful combos like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Life from the Loam provides a steady stream of resources, allowing the player to continually recur lands and maintain advantage. Crop Rotation and Gamble provide additional versatility and consistency in setting up the deck's key synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Mother of Runes, Knight of the Reliquary, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, alongside powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords to Plowshares to quickly establish board presence and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Qasali Pridemage to handle opposing threats. With a mana base that includes powerful lands like Karakas and Gaea's Cradle, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with its aggressive creatures and equipment synergy.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Swords to Plowshares to control the board and protect its creatures. The deck includes powerful utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's mana base. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver its opponents in order to secure a victory.

This deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan by using aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic, along with disruptive cards like Aven Mindcensor and Gaddock Teeg, the deck can quickly overpower the opponent while controlling the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes powerful lands like Dark Depths and Karakas to further enhance its strategic options and ensure victory in the long run. Overall, this deck combines aggression and disruption to create a formidable and versatile strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently apply pressure on the opponent using creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Knight of the Reliquary. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull enhances the aggressive strategy, while cards like Abrupt Decay and Swords to Plowshares provide disruption and removal options. The deck also incorporates utility lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Karakas to further control the game, making it a versatile and synergistic Aggro - Maverick archetype for Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive play, using efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Knight of the Reliquary to pressure the opponent. It also includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords to Plowshares to control the board and protect your creatures. The inclusion of cards like Scavenging Ooze and Deathrite Shaman provide additional utility and disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the ability to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat in Enter the Infinite, allowing the player to draw their entire deck, play Emrakul, the Aeons Torn for free, and win the game in one turn. The deck uses cantrips like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to find key pieces, while also including interaction in the form of Force of Will and Pact of Negation to protect the combo. Cunning Wish allows for additional tools to be accessed from the sideboard in response to different situations.

The deck focuses on using cards like Careful Study, Entomb, and Reanimate to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Iona. By combining these graveyard manipulation spells with cards like Show and Tell and Exhume, the deck is able to cheat these creatures into play for little to no mana, often leading to an explosive victory. The inclusion of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will helps protect the combo pieces, while cards like Thoughtseize and Brainstorm provide additional card selection and disruption against opponents.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce while utilizing powerful card advantage engines like Treasure Cruise and Snapcaster Mage. The deck utilizes the Stoneblade package of Stoneforge Mystic, Batterskull, and Umezawa's Jitte to provide a strong win condition and stabilize the board. Additionally, the deck includes efficient removal in Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay, as well as flexible threats like True-Name Nemesis. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and allow for consistent access to its powerful spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It leverages the powerful synergy between Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to both control the board and pressure the opponent. With a mix of powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and versatile spells like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in the long game. Karakas adds additional utility against legendary creatures, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and versatile board control.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal, counterspells, and hand disruption. It aims to establish board presence with efficient threats like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to maintain control. The deck also has access to strong card advantage spells like Brainstorm and Treasure Cruise to outvalue the opponent. With a diverse mana base and a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and threats, this deck seeks to outmaneuver opponents in resource management and maintain dominant control over the game.

The main concept of this Legacy combo Storm deck revolves around efficiently generating mana and card advantage to set up and execute a game-winning combo using cards like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond. The deck includes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to filter through the deck and find combo pieces, along with disruption cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to cast Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to generate a lethal storm count and win the game in a single turn.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana through powerful rituals and fast mana sources, then cast a series of spells to build up storm count before finishing with Tendrils of Agony for a lethal amount of damage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with discard spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress, while also utilizing cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to dig for combo pieces. The inclusion of Past in Flames allows for a potential second chance at storming off if the initial attempt is disrupted.

The main concept of this Dark Depths combo deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Dark Depths and Thespian?s Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Crop Rotation to accelerate the combo, while also running disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Force of Will to protect the combo from opposing decks. The deck aims to win the game quickly by generating a powerful creature that can easily close out the game in just a few turns.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. By efficiently using cantrips and mana denial cards, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game while consistently applying pressure with creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also utilizes powerful draw spells like Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage and burn spells like Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent. Overall, this deck thrives on speed, efficiency, and aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on maximizing efficiency and aggression, utilizing cheap cantrips and disruptive spells to maintain tempo and protect its threats. It aims to quickly establish a board presence with efficient aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Monastery Swiftspear, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck's ability to draw cards and refill its hand with Treasure Cruise allows it to maintain pressure and close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly gaining board advantage and pushing through damage with efficient creatures and burn spells. Utilizing powerful card draw and disruption, it aims to control the tempo of the game and prevent opponents from stabilizing. The mana base is built to support a fast, aggressive playstyle, while also providing access to the necessary colors for all spells. By applying early pressure and maintaining strong board presence, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with cheap spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes efficient burn spells like Chain Lightning and Lightning Bolt, along with early creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to apply pressure and win the game quickly. Additionally, it includes card draw and control elements with Treasure Cruise and Force of Will to maintain card advantage and protect its threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt opponents with a combination of counterspells, removal, and graveyard hate, while also controlling the game with card advantage and manipulation. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents by using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Energy Field, and Sensei's Divining Top to generate advantage. It also has a win condition in the form of Entreat the Angels or Helm of Obedience, allowing the deck to close out games once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled and disrupted.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of the deck, the player can effectively counter their opponent's spells. Additionally, cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provide additional card advantage and versatility. The deck aims to stabilize the board with sweepers like Terminus and finish off the opponent with powerful threats like Entreat the Angels. Overall, the key concept is utilizing control elements to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.
